job_title: Medical Office Assistant in Binghamton, NY
pros:
A close-knit cooperative team working to provide the best care for patients. 
The staff caring for a patient are compassionate, empathetic, and willing to help a patient get better in order to go home.
cons:
Coworkers are duplicitous, backstabbing,  uncaring of each other. Management allows bullying tactics up to and including post it notes of alleged infractions, doesn't investigate, and wants perfection in some not all employees. Plays favorites
attending physicians do not communicate with each other and do not check the chart before ordering lab tests. This causes multiple blood draws within the same hour with no regard for the patient.
Costly test s are ordered when they are not needed.
Emergency room patients are left waiting for hours without seeing a physician

review_title: Best hospital system in Southern Tier
job_title: Staff RN in Binghamton, NY
pros: Great opportunities for graduate nurses or associate level nurses -- other hospital will not consider ADN's. Lots of $$$ and incentives to get more education. General is the smaller of the two hospitals which seems (to me) to be a more relaxed atmosphere. Hands down wonderful staff who genuinely cares about patient care. Most nurse managers are approachable. Charge nurses are incredible!! If you are a good team player & play nice with the other nurses,  this is a good place for you!
cons: Challenging hard work for the new grad. Not a moment to waste!!  Upper level politics are no different than anywhere else. Too much time spent on charting patient care and not enough time to do patient care. Senior management is mostly out of touch with patient population, concerns and expectations.   Some overly-scripted "patient satisfaction" attempts that do not work. Highly suggest becoming part of the committees/teams/councils to help direct the focus back to real patient satisfaction.

review_title: This is a reputable organization to work for where they treat their employees as well as they do their patients.
job_title: Access Care Representative in Vestal, NY
pros: Working for United Health Services was a pleasant experience for me. I worked in a clean, safe, and respectable work environment. I had positive interaction with fellow employees, supervisors, and other office staff. There wasn't much of a requirement for overtime, weekend hours. My supervisor was easy to approach for any situation, whether positive or negative, and able to maintain a professional and friendly relationship. They offer decent rate of pay that tends to be higher than their local competition as well as offer great health benefits. I found them to be a great company to work for. My reason for leaving them was a personal one; my decision to stay home with my daughter. I highly recommend working for them.
cons: I didn't find any negatives about working for this company.

review_title: Decent Benefits, Low Pay, Stay Away From the HIM Dept.
job_title: Inpatient Coder in Binghamton, NY
pros: Contributing to the health of the community, decent health /dental benefits. Tuition forgiveness for some types of employees.
cons: Depending on your role and the department you work in, your experience may not be a good one. Management in the HIM department are not qualified to be there and treat their employees like second rate citizens. Plan on being blamed for everything, gaslighted if you complain, and your supervisor and department manager not being held accountable for their lack of competence and professional integrity, and blatant irresponsibility.   They also say they want to hire within for new advancement opportunities but won't even give you an interview and hire vendors instead. Low flexibility with work schedule.  Can no longer work from home in certain departments.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Binghamton, NY
pros: Slightly above minimum wage pay, opportunity to transfer or advance, tuition assistance, benefits to full time employees, credit union
cons: Hiring process is long, training stinks, communication stinks,  schedules stink, no paid holidays-you have to use your own earned paid time off to get a paid holiday. Benefits are super expensive and you can only use UHS doctors-with the pay barely above minimum wage the fees for the medical coverage for a family (4+ people) are over $500 a month-if you're a single parent there's no way to afford that and pay your normal bills

review_title: Competative pay, ok benefits, good vacation
job_title: Food Service Supervisor in Binghamton, NY
pros: Pay is good for location. Benefits are good but a little costly. Vacation time is accrued base on time employeed and how many hours you work. Longterm, full time employees get more than enough vacation time. Opportumitiets to transfer with in UHS to different department if you are looking for a change/promotion.
cons:
health insurance is made to make it so you if you choose to go outside of UHS for care you pay ALOT. Sometimes theres a doctor you've had and want to keep, if there not UHS thats sometimes hard. There is NO options for health ins. its one plan. 
Managment from the new food and nutrtion company can be difficult to work with.

review_title: UHS is ever growing and expanding leaving so much room to move within the company once becoming a part of it.

cons: It has grown in to a corporate world of policies and procedures that are hard to keep up with sometimes.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Johnson City, NY

job_title: in Binghamton, NY
pros: relatively attractive compensation, lots of growth, organization has a vision and sticks to it.  staff are generally  friendly and committed, and leadership means well.
cons: growing bureaucracy, physician politics, antiquated facilities and infrastructure.  Being a healthcare organization, there is the inevitable external turmoil that comes with that territory.  Then there's the added component of being located in New York state, that never saw anything it couldn't try to ambiguously over-regulate and license.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Johnson City, NY

cons: Management.  Poor relationships between units & departments.  Location has become unsafe.  Limited advancement opportunities.  The company does not seem to pay much attention to the needs of the nursing units - many are outdated.
